bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Surgical Research Society was formed in 1915. In its early years, meetings were held biannually, but later a system of two day yearly meetings was adopted. Members hailed from Baltimore, Boston, Philadelphia, and New York City, as well as other cities on a case by case basis. Meetings were held in these cities, with the chosen city's members acting as host.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This small collection primarily contains minutes, meeting programs, correspondence, membership lists, and other records of the Society. A letter concerning the transfer of these records to the New York Academy of Medicine is also included.
